intro: Colymbada prolongi, commonly known as the long-stemmed water lily, is a semi-aquatic plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features broad, floating leaves that provide shade and oxygen to aquatic ecosystems. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with a distinctive, showy structure that attracts pollinators such as beetles and flies. The plant has a fibrous root system that anchors it in shallow water and helps stabilize sediment. Colymbada prolongi plays a vital role in maintaining water quality and supporting aquatic biodiversity.
